Is diagnosis code No. B1453 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent Malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1476 POWER SUPPLY VOLTAGE [IG1 (A) VOLTAGE] DROPS ABNORMALLY
Code No. B1476: IG1 power supply open circuit (Fuse No. 15 circuit)
Code No. B1477: IG1 power supply open circuit (Fuse No. 21 circuit)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1476 (fuse No. 15) or B1477 (fuse No. 21) is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
SRS-ECU has two independent battery power supplies circuit (fuse Nos. 15 and 21) having fuses.
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the voltage between the IG1 terminal (SRS-ECU terminal IG1A or IG1B) and the earth drops below the specified value for 5 seconds continuously. Also, if the code Nos. B1476 and B1477 are set at the same time, the battery voltage may have dropped. Therefore, check the battery first.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit to power supply circuit
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
  • Malfunction of ETACS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Power supply fuse check
Is the fuse in good condition?
Go to Step 3.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Fuse open circuit check
(1) Replace the fuse.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position, wait for at least one minute, and then turn the switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Check the fuse.
Is the fuse in good condition?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the wiring harness IG1A line between the junction block connector and the SRS-ECU connector <fuse No. 15>, IG1B line between the junction block connector and the SRS-ECU connector <fuse No. 21> and replace the power supply fuse.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the CAN bus lines (refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ). Then go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III other system diagnosis code
Check if the ETACS diagnosis code is set.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Diagnose the ETACS (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS - Troubleshooting ).
Check the input signal of ETACS-ECU ignition switch (IG1) (Refer to GROUP 54A - Check Trouble by Using The Input Signal Check ). Then go to Step 5 .
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1476 or B1477 set?
Go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(3) Take the measurements below at the wiring harness side connectors.
  • Continuity GND1 line between wiring harness side connector and body earth
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the wiring harness GND1 line between the SRS-ECU connector and the body earth.
 
STEP 7. Voltage measurement at the SRS-ECU connector (IG1A, IG1B line)
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(6) Take the measurements below at the harness side connector.
  • Voltage IG1A, IG1B line between SRS-ECU connector and body earth
OK: 9 V or more
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the junction block connector.
(3) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(4) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(5)
  • Continuity IG1A line between junction block connector and SRS-ECU connector
  • Continuity IG1B line between junction block connector and SRS-ECU connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Replace the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ).
Repair the wiring harness IG1A line between the junction block connector and the SRS-ECU connector, IG1B line between the junction block connector and the SRS-ECU connector.
 
STEP 9. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1476 or B1477 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1480 DRIVER'S AIR BAG SQUIB SHORT-CIRCUITED<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1480: Driver's air bag module (squib) system (short circuit between squib circuit terminals) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. B1480 (squib) is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the driver's air bag module (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the short circuit occurs to between the terminals of SRS-ECU driver's air bag module (squib) circuit.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged short spring *
  • Short circuit in the clock spring
  • Short circuit between terminals of driver's air bag module (squib) circuit
  • Damaged connector(s)
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
note *: The squib circuit connectors integrate a short spring (which prevents the air bags from being unintentionally deployed because of static electricity by shorting the positive wire to the earth wire in the squib circuit when the connectors are disconnected). Therefore, when the above codes are set, the short spring may not be released due to the damaged connector even when the connectors are connected.
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1480 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Connector check: SRS-ECU, clock spring, driver's air bag module
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever. After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again.
(3) After disconnecting clock spring, connect it again.
(4) Disconnect the driver's air bag module connector using the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button to the direction of the arrow, and connect it again.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1480 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the connector concerned.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991866).
(4)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Insert the resistor harness probe (special tool) as shown.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1480 set?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the driver's air bag module (Refer to )
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the clock spring connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991866).
(4)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Insert the resistor harness probe from the back of harness side connector DQ2-, DQ2+ line.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1480 set?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the clock spring (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector.
(3)
cautionTo release SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this clock spring connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Disconnect the clock spring connector.
(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert the insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the DQ2-, DQ2+ line, and then release the short spring.
(5) Take the measurements below at the harness side connector.
Continuity between DQ2-, DQ2+ line
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the wiring harnesses DQ2-, DQ2+ line between the clock spring connector and the SRS-ECU connector.
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1480 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1481 DRIVER'S AIR BAG SQUIB OPEN-CIRCUITED<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1481: Driver's air bag module (squib) system (open circuit of squib circuit) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1481 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the driver's air bag module (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the open circuit occurs to the SRS-ECU driver's air bag module (squib) circuit.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit in the clock spring
  • Open circuit due to improper neutral position of the clock spring
  • Open circuit to driver's air bag module (squib) circuit
  • Disengaged driver's air bag module (squib) connector
  • Poor contact of connector
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1481 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991866).
(4)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Insert the resistor harness probe (special tool) as shown.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1481 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the driver's air bag module (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the clock spring connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991866).
(4)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Insert the resistor harness probe from the back of harness side connector DQ2-, DQ2+ line.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1481 set?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the clock spring (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU and the C-313 clock spring connectors
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector.
(3)
cautionTo release SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this clock spring connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Disconnect the clock spring connector.
(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert the insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the DQ2-, DQ2+ line, and then release the short spring.

(5)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal of clock spring connector harness side connector from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU connector and clock spring connector harness side connectors.
  • Continuity DQ2- line between SRS-ECU connector and clock spring connector
  • Continuity DQ2+ line between SRS-ECU connector and clock spring connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harnesses DQ2-, DQ2+ line between the clock spring connector and the SRS-ECU connector.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1481 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1482 DRIVER'S AIR BAG SQUIB DRIVE CIRCUIT (EARTH SIDE) SHORT-CIRCUITED<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1482: Driver's air bag module (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit earth) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1482 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the driver's air bag module (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU driver's air bag module (squib) shorted to earth.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged clock spring
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Driver's air bag module (squib) harness shorted to earth
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU

(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.

(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991866).

(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the clock spring connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991866).
(4)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Insert the resistor harness probe from the back of harness side connector DQ2-, DQ2+ line.

(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector.
(3)
cautionTo release SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this clock spring connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Disconnect the clock spring connector.
(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert the insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the DQ2-, DQ2+ line, and then release the short spring.

(5) Take the measurements below at the harness side connector.
  • Continuity between DQ2-, DQ2+ line and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harnesses DQ2-, DQ2+ line between the clock spring connector and the SRS-ECU connector.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1482 set?

52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1483 DRIVER'S AIR BAG SQUIB DRIVE CIRCUIT (POWER SUPPLY SIDE) SHORT-CIRCUITED<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1483: Driver's air bag module (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit power supply) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1483 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the driver's air bag module (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU driver's air bag module (squib) shorted to power supply.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged clock spring
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Driver's air bag module (squib) harness shorted to power supply
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU

(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.

  • Voltage between DQ2-, DQ2+ line and body earth
OK: 1 V or less
(8) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.

52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1488 AIR BAG OFF INDICATOR LAMP CIRCUIT MALFUNCTION
Code No. B1488: Passenger's air bag OFF indicator lamp (short circuited)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1488 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power for the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp is supplied from the Ignition switch (IG1) <Vehicles without KOS> or the IG1 relay <Vehicles with KOS>.
  • The passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp illuminates when the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position and goes out after approximately 6 to 8 seconds if there is not a malfunction in the SRS system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
This code will be set if the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp driving circuit is short to earth.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harnesses or connectors
  • Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1488 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Check the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp.
It is checked whether passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp is normal (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace hazard indicator assembly (Refer to GROUP 52A, Instrument Centre Panel ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Disconnect the hazard indicator assembly connector.
(5) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU connector.
  • Continuity between OFLP line and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harnesses OFLP line between the SRS-ECU connector and the hazard indicator assembly connector.
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at the hazard indicator assembly connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Take the following measurements at the backside of the hazard indicator assembly side connector (harness side).
(5)
  • Continuity between LP line and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harnesses LP line between the hazard indicator assembly connector and the body earth.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1488 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1489 AIR BAG OFF INDICATOR LAMP OPEN-CIRCUITED
Code No. B1489: Passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp (open circuit)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1489 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power for the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp is supplied from the Ignition switch (IG1) <Vehicles without KOS> or the IG1 relay <Vehicles with KOS>.
  • The passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp illuminates when the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position and goes out after approximately 6 to 8 seconds if there is not a malfunction in the SRS system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
This code will be set if an open circuit has occurred in the wiring harness between the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp and the SRS-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harnesses or connectors
  • Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1489 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Check the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp.
It is checked whether passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp is normal (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace hazard indicator assembly (Refer to GROUP 52A - Instrument Centre Panel ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector and the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Disconnect the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp connector.
(5) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU and passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp wiring harness side connectors.
  • Continuity OFLP line between SRS-ECU connector and passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harnesses OFLP line between the SRS-ECU connector and the hazard indicator assembly connector.
 
STEP 5. Measure the voltage at the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp connector.
(1) Disconnect the passenger’s air bag OFF indicator lamp connector.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(4) Measure the voltage between the hazard indicator assembly harness side connector and the body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harness power supply line between the Ignition switch (IG1) <Vehicles without KOS> or IG1 relay <Vehicles with KOS> and the hazard indicator assembly.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1489 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1499 IGNITION OF THE AIR BAG COMPLETED
Code No. B1499: Air bag deployment determined by SRS-ECU
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code B1499 is set in the SRS-ECU, always diagnose the CAN main bus line.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
This diagnosis code is set after the air bag has deployed. If this diagnosis code is set before the air bag has deployed, the cause is probably a malfunction inside the SRS-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1509 INCORRECT SRS-ECU
Code No. B1509: Incorrect installation of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
If SRS-ECU different from the unit compatible to vehicle is accidentally installed, this code will be set.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
  • Mismatch between vehicle and SRS-ECU specifications
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1519 SRS-ECU CONNECTOR LOCK OUT OF ORDER
Code No. B1519: SRS-ECU connector lock out of order
 
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set if a poor connection at the SRS-ECU is detected.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged connectors
  • Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1519 set?
Go to Step 3.
The diagnosis is complete (diagnosis code No. B1519 is set due to improper engaged connector).
 
STEP 3. Check at the SRS-ECU connector.
(1) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(3) Check the connector lock switch terminal inside the harness side connector for improper contact or deformation.
Is the connector lock switch normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the connector.
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1519 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent Malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1570 PASSENGER'S AIR BAG CUT OFF SWITCH MALFUNCTION
Code No. B1570: Passenger's air bag cut off switch malfunction
Code No. B1574: Passenger's air bag cut off switch circuit open
Code No. B1575: Passenger's air bag cut off switch circuit (earth side) shorted
Code No. B1576: Passenger's air bag cut off switch circuit (power supply side) shorted
Code No. B1581: Incorrect passenger's air bag cut off switch
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1570, B1574, B1575, B1576 or B1581 is set in the SRS-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus lines.
 
 
OPERATION
According to the passenger’s air bag cut off switch connecting position, the SRS-ECU judges the deployment and non-deployment of passenger’s (front) air bag.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
Diagnosis code is set when the resistance between input terminals of the passenger’s air bag cut off switch is without the standard value.
Cause of trouble in each diagnosis code is as follows.
Code No.Symptom
B1570Malfunction of passenger’s air bag cut off switch
B1574Malfunction of the common terminal or open circuit in its harness
B1575Short to body earth in the common terminal harness
B1576Short to the power supply in the common terminal harness
B1581Mismatch between vehicle and passenger's air bag cut off switch specifications.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the passenger’s air bag cut off switch
  • Damaged wiring harnesses or connectors
  • Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - Diagnosis-CAN Bus Diagnostic Chart ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1570, B1574, B1575, B1576 or B1581 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Check the passenger’s air bag cut off switch.
Check of a passenger’s air bag cut off switch (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace passenger’s air bag cut off switch (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Check the passenger’s air bag cut off switch circuit. Resistance measurement at SRS-ECU connector.
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Switch the passenger’s air bag cut off switch to air bag ON side.
(5) Measure the resistance between POF-, POFO line.
OK: 820 ± 20 Ω
(6) Switch the passenger’s air bag cut off switch to air bag OFF side.
(7) Measure the resistance between POF-, POFO line.
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the harness wires POF-, POFO line between SRS-ECU connector and passenger’s air bag cut off switch connector.
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Disconnect the passenger’s air bag cut off switch connector.
(5) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Continuity between POF-, POFO line and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the harness wires POF-, POFO line between SRS-ECU connector and passenger’s air bag cut off switch connector.
 
STEP 6. Voltage measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Disconnect the passenger’s air bag cut off switch connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(7) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Voltage between POF-, POFO line and body earth
OK: 1 V or less
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the harness wires POF-, POFO line between SRS-ECU connector and passenger’s air bag cut off switch connector.
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1570, B1574, B1575, B1576 or B1581 set?
Replace the SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
An intermittent malfunction is suspected (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1603 DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT BELT PRE-TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1603: Seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) system (short circuit between squib circuit terminals)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1603 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the short circuit occurs between the terminals of SRS-ECU seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) circuit.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged short spring *
  • Short circuit between terminals of seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) circuit
  • Damaged connector(s)
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
  • Insufficient press of locking button or locking button not pressed
note*: The squib circuit connectors integrate a short spring (which prevents the seat belt pre-tensioner from being unintentionally deployed because of static electricity by shorting the positive wire to the earth wire in the squib circuit when the connectors are disconnected). Therefore, when the above codes are set, the short spring may not be released due to the damaged connector even when the connectors are connected.
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1603 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Connector check: SRS-ECU connector, seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever. After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) After disconnecting the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector, connect the connector again. For the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector disconnection, use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the harness side connector locking button. After releasing the lock, disconnect the harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1603 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the connector concerned.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1603 set?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PTD+, PTD- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.
(6) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Continuity between PTD+, PTD- line
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harness PTD+, PTD- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) connector.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1603 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1604 DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT BELT PRE-TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1604: Seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) system (open circuit of squib circuit)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1604 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the open circuit occurs to the SRS-ECU seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) circuit.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Poor contact of connector
  • Open circuit to seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) circuit
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1604 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect the special tool resistor harness to the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1604 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector and the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PTD+, PTD- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.

(6)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal of pre-tensioner (driver’s side) connector harness side connector from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU connector and seat belt pre-tensioner connector harness side connectors.
  • Continuity PTD- line between SRS-ECU connector and seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) connector
  • Continuity PTD+ line between SRS-ECU connector and seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness PTD+, PTD- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1604 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1605 DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT BELT PRE-TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1605: Seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit earth)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1605 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) is shorted to earth
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connector
  • Seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) harness shorted to earth.
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1605 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1605 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PTD+, PTD- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.
(6) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Continuity PTD+, PTD- line between SRS-ECU connector and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness PTD+, PTD- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the seat belt pre-tensioner connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1605 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1606 DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT BELT PRE-TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1606: Seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit power supply)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1606 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) is shorted to power supply.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connector
  • Seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (squib) harness shorted to power supply
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1606 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1606 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (driver’s side) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Voltage measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (driver’s side) harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PTD+, PTD- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.
(6) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(7) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(8) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Voltage PTD+, PTD- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the body earth
OK: 1 V or less
(9) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness PTD+, PTD- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the seat belt pre-tensioner connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1606 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1609 FRONT PASSENGER'S SIDE SEAT BELT PRE-TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1609: Seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (squib) system (short circuit between squib circuit terminals)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1609 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the short circuit occurs to between the terminals of SRS-ECU seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (squib) circuit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged short spring *
  • Short circuit between terminals of seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (squib) circuit
  • Damaged connector(s)
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
  • Insufficient press of locking button or locking button not pressed
note *: The squib circuit connectors integrate a short spring (which prevents the seat belt pre-tensioner from being unintentionally deployed because of static electricity by shorting the positive wire to the earth wire in the squib circuit when the connectors are disconnected). Therefore, when the above codes are set, the short spring may not be released due to the damaged connector even when the connectors are connected.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1609 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Connector check: SRS-ECU, seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side)
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever. After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) After disconnecting the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) harness side connector, connect the connector again. For the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) harness side connector disconnection, use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the harness side connector locking button. After releasing the lock, disconnect the harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1609 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the connector concerned.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1609 set?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PTA+, PTA- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.
(6) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Continuity between PTA+, PTA- line
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harness PTA+, PTA- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) connector.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1609 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1610 FRONT PASSENGER'S SIDE SEAT BELT PRE-TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1610: Seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (squib) system (open circuit of squib circuit)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1610 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the open circuit occurs to the SRS-ECU seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (squib) circuit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Poor contact of connector
  • Open circuit to seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (squib) circuit
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1610 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1610 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector and the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PTA+, PTA- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.

(6)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal of pre-tensioner (passenger's side) connector harness side connector from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU connector and seat belt pre-tensioner connector harness side connectors.
  • Continuity PTA- line between SRS-ECU connector and seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) connector
  • Continuity PTA+ line between SRS-ECU connector and seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness PTA+, PTA- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger's side) connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1610 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to SRS-ECU ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1611 FRONT PASSENGER'S SIDE SEAT BELT PRE-TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1611: Seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit earth)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1611 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).

The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (squib) is shorted to earth.

  • Damaged wiring harness and connector
  • Seat belt pre-tensioner (passenger’s side) (squib) harness shorted to earth
