52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1616 SRS-ECU SAFING G-SENSOR (ELECTRONIC SAFING CIRCUIT FAILURE)
Code No. B1616: SRS-ECU safing G-sensor (electronic safing circuit failure)
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
These diagnosis codes are set when a fault is detected in the SRS-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set in SRS-ECU.
(1) Before erasing the diagnosis code, turn the ignition switch from "LOCK" (OFF) position to "ON" position.
(2) Erase the diagnosis code.
(3) On completion, check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is the diagnosis code No. B1616 set?
Replace the SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1617 ROLL RATE SENSOR MALFUNCTION
Code No. B1617: Roll over sensor malfunction
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1617 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
The code is set if an abnormality is detected in the circuit inside the SRS-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLESHOOTING HINTS
Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set in the SRS-ECU.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch from "LOCK" (OFF) position to "ON" position.
(3) On completion, check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Replace the SRS-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1619 DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT LAP PRE_TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1619: Driver's lap pre-tensioner (squib) system (short circuit between squib circuit terminals)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1619 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal collision impact that exceeds the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the lap pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the short circuit occurs to between the terminals of SRS-ECU lap pre-tensioner (squib) circuit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged short spring *
  • Short circuit between terminals of lap pre-tensioner (squib) circuit
  • Damaged connector(s)
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
  • Insufficient press of locking button or locking button not pressed
note*: The squib circuit connectors integrate a short spring (which prevents the lap pre-tensioner from being unintentionally deployed because of static electricity by shorting the positive wire to the earth wire in the squib circuit when the connectors are disconnected). Therefore, when the above codes are set, the short spring may not be released due to the damaged connector even when the connectors are connected.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1619 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Connector check: SRS-ECU, lap pre-tensioner
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever. After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) After disconnecting the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector, connect the connector again. For the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector disconnection, use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the harness side connector locking button. After releasing the lock, disconnect the harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1619 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the connector concerned.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991866).
(4) Connect resistor harness to the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1619 set?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this lap pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PD2+, PD2- line and the short spring and release the short spring.
(6) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Continuity between PD2+, PD2- line
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harness PD2+, PD2- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the lap pre-tensioner connector.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1619 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1620 DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT LAP PRE_TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1620: Driver's lap pre-tensioner (squib) system (open circuit of squib circuit)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1620 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the lap pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the open circuit occurs to the SRS-ECU lap pre-tensioner (squib) circuit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Poor contact of connector
  • Open circuit to lap pre-tensioner (squib) circuit
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1620 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(3) Connect the special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to the special tool resistor harness (MB991866).
(4) Connect the special tool resistor harness to the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1620 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector and the lap pre-tensioner connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this lap pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PD2+, PD2- line and the short spring and release the short spring.

(6)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal of clock spring connector harness side connector from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU connector and lap pre-tensioner connector harness side connectors.
  • Continuity PD2- line between SRS-ECU connector and lap pre-tensioner connector
  • Continuity PD2+ line between SRS-ECU connector and lap pre-tensioner connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness PD2+, PD2- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the lap pre-tensioner connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1620 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1621 DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT LAP PRE_TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1621: Driver's lap pre-tensioner (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit earth)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1621 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal collision impact that exceeds the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the lap pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU lap pre-tensioner (squib) is shorted to earth.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connector
  • Lap pre-tensioner (squib) harness shorted to earth
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1621 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(3) Connect the special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to the special tool resistor harness (MB991866).
(4) Connect the special tool resistor harness to the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1621 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this lap pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PD2+, PD2- line and the short spring and release the short spring.
(6) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Continuity between PD2+, PD2- line and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness PD2+, PD2- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the lap pre-tensioner connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1621 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1622 DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT LAP PRE_TENSIONER (SQUIB) SYSTEM
Code No. B1622: Driver's lap pre-tensioner (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit power supply)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1622 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal collision impact that exceeds the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the lap pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU lap pre-tensioner (squib) circuit is shorted to power supply.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connector
  • Lap pre-tensioner (squib) harness shorted to power supply
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1622 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(3) Connect the special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to the special tool resistor harness (MB991866).
(4) Connect the special tool resistor harness to the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1622 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the seat belt with pre-tensioner (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Voltage measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this lap pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the lap pre-tensioner harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the PD2+, PD2- line and the short spring and release the short spring.
(6) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(7) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(8) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Voltage between PD2+, PD2- line and body earth
OK: 1 V or less
(9) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness PD2+, PD2- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the lap pre-tensioner connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1622 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1631 DRIVER'S KNEE AIR BAG SQUIB SHORT-CIRCUITED
Code No. B1631: Knee air bag module (squib) system (short circuit between squib circuit terminals)
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. B1631 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the knee air bag module (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the short circuit occurs to between the terminals of SRS-ECU knee air bag module (squib) circuit.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged short spring *
  • Short circuit between terminals of knee air bag module (squib) circuit
  • Damaged connector(s)
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
note *: The squib circuit connectors integrate a short spring (which prevents the air bags from being unintentionally deployed because of static electricity by shorting the positive wire to the earth wire in the squib circuit when the connectors are disconnected). Therefore, when the above codes are set, the short spring may not be released due to the damaged connector even when the connectors are connected.
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1631 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Connector check: knee air bag module, SRS-ECU
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever. After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock, connect the connector again.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1631 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the connector concerned.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock.
(3) Connect the dummy resistor (Special tool: MB991865) to the resistor harness (Special tool: MB991884).
(4) Connect the resistor harness (special tool) to knee air bag module connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1631 set?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the knee air bag module (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this harness side connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the KDS+, KDS- line, and then release the short spring.
(6) Take the measurements below at the harness side connector.
  • Continuity between the KDS+, KDS- line
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harnesses KDS+, KDS- line between the knee air bag module connector and the SRS-ECU connector.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1631 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1632 DRIVER'S KNEE AIR BAG SQUIB OPEN-CIRCUITED
Code No. B1632: Knee air bag module (squib) system (open circuit of squib circuit)
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. B1632 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the knee air bag module (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the open circuit occurs to the SRS-ECU knee air bag module (squib) circuit.

  • Open circuit in the knee air bag module (squib) circuit
  • Poor contact of connector
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU

(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.

Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).

(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock.
(3) Connect the dummy resistor (Special tool: MB991865) to the resistor harness (Special tool: MB991884).
(4) Connect the resistor harness (special tool) to right curtain air bag module connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.

Replace the knee air bag module (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector and the knee air bag module connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this harness side connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the KDS+, KDS- line, and then release the short spring.
(6)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal of harness side connector from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU connector and knee air bag module connector harness side connectors.
  • Continuity KDS- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the knee air bag module connector
  • Continuity KDS+ line between the SRS-ECU connector and the knee air bag module connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harnesses KDS+, KDS- line between the knee air bag module connector and the SRS-ECU connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1632 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1633 DRIVER'S KNEE AIR BAG SQUIB CIRCUIT(EARTH SIDE)
Code No. B1633: Knee air bag module (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit earth)
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. B1633 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the knee air bag module (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU knee air bag module (squib) circuit is shorted to earth.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Knee air bag module (squib) harness shorted to earth
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis codes No. B1633 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock.
(3) Connect the dummy resistor (Special tool: MB991865) to the resistor harness (Special tool: MB991884).
(4) Connect the resistor harness (special tool) to right curtain air bag module connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1633 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the knee air bag module (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this harness side connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the KDS+, KDS- line, and then release the short spring.
(6) Take the measurements below at the harness side connector.
  • Continuity between KDS+, KDS- line and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair KDS+, KDS- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the knee air bag module connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1633 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1634 DRIVER'S KNEE AIR BAG SQUIB CIRCUIT (POWER SUPPLY)
Code No. B1634: Knee air bag module (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit power supply)
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. B1634 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the knee air bag module (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU knee air bag module (squib) shorted to power supply.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Knee air bag module (squib) harness shorted to power supply
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1634 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of wiring harness side connector, and release the lock.
(3) Connect the dummy resistor (Special tool: MB991865) to the resistor harness (Special tool: MB991884).
(4) Connect the resistor harness (special tool) to right curtain air bag module connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1634 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the knee air bag module (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Voltage measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4)
dangerTo release the connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this harness side connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Slide the outer housing of harness side connector in the arrow direction shown, and disconnect the harness side connector.
(5)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the KDS+, KDS- line, and then release the short spring.
(6) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(7) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(8) Take the measurements below at the harness side connector.
OK: 1 V or less
(9) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harnesses KDS+, KDS- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the knee air bag module connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1634 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1646 Coding data mismatch
Code No. B1646: Coding data mismatch
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. B1646 is set, diagnose the CAN bus lines.
  • When replacing the ECU, always check that the communication circuit is normal.
 
 
FUNCTION
If a false coding data is written in the SRS-ECU, the SRS-ECU will store diagnosis code No. B1646.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
When correct coding data is not received from ETACS-ECU, SRS-ECU will determine that the a problem has occurred.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of CAN bus line
  • Malfunction of ETACS-ECU
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
2. M.U.T.-III other system diagnosis code
3. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1647 PS ABG ON lamp circuit
Code No. B1647: Passenger's air bag ON indicator lamp (short circuited)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1647 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power for the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp is supplied from the Ignition switch (IG1) <Vehicles without KOS> or the IG1 relay <Vehicles with KOS>.
  • The passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp illuminates when the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position and goes out after approximately 6 to 8 seconds if there is not a malfunction in the SRS system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
This code will be set if the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp driving circuit is short to earth.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harnesses or connectors
  • Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1647 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Check the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp.
It is checked whether passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp is normal (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace hazard indicator assembly (Refer to GROUP 52A - Instrument Centre Panel ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Disconnect the hazard indicator assembly connector.
(5) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU connector.
  • Continuity between OFLP line and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harnesses OFLP line between the SRS-ECU connector and the hazard indicator assembly connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1647 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1648 PS ABG ON lamp circuit open
Code No. B1648: Passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp (open circuit)
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1648 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power for the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp is supplied from the Ignition switch (IG1) <Vehicles without KOS> or the IG1 relay <Vehicles with KOS>.
  • The passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp illuminates when the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position and goes out after approximately 6 to 8 seconds if there is not a malfunction in the SRS system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
This code will be set if an open circuit has occurred in the wiring harness between the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp and the SRS-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harnesses or connectors
  • Malfunction of the SRS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1648 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Check the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp.
It is checked whether passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp is normal (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace hazard indicator assembly (Refer to GROUP 52A - Instrument Centre Panel ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector and the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Club cab and vehicles for RUSSIA (without ERA-GLONASS system)>
(3) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector. <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
(4) Disconnect the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp connector.
(5) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU and passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp wiring harness side connectors.
  • Continuity OFLP line between SRS-ECU connector and the hazard indicator assembly connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harnesses OFLP line between the SRS-ECU connector and the hazard indicator assembly connector.
 
STEP 5. Measure the voltage at the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp connector.
(1) Disconnect the passenger’s air bag ON indicator lamp connector.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(4) Measure the voltage between the hazard indicator assembly harness side connector and the body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harness power supply line between the Ignition switch (IG1) <Vehicles without KOS> or IG1 relay <Vehicles with KOS> and the hazard indicator assembly
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1648 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1653 2ND SEAT (RH) PRETEN. SQUIB SHORT<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1653: Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) system (short circuit between squib circuit terminals) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1653 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the short circuit occurs between the terminals of SRS-ECU rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) circuit.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged short spring *
  • Short circuit between terminals of rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) circuit
  • Damaged connector(s)
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
  • Insufficient press of locking button or locking button not pressed
note*: The squib circuit connectors integrate a short spring (which prevents the rear seat belt pre-tensioner from being unintentionally deployed because of static electricity by shorting the positive wire to the earth wire in the squib circuit when the connectors are disconnected). Therefore, when the above codes are set, the short spring may not be released due to the damaged connector even when the connectors are connected.
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1653 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Connector check: SRS-ECU connector, rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever. After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again.
(3) After disconnecting the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector, connect the connector again. For the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector disconnection, use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the harness side connector locking button. After releasing the lock, disconnect the harness side connector.
(4) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(5) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(6) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1653 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the connector concerned.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1653 set?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the rear seat belt with pre-tensioner (RH) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector.
(3)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the RPR+, RPR- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.
(5) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Continuity between RPR+, RPR- line
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harness RPR+, RPR- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) connector.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1653 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1654 2ND SEAT (RH) PRETEN. SQUIB OPEN<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1654: Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) system (open circuit of squib circuit) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1654 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the open circuit occurs to the SRS-ECU rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) circuit.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Poor contact of connector
  • Open circuit to rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) circuit
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1654 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect the special tool resistor harness to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1654 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the rear seat belt with pre-tensioner (RH) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector and the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector.
(3)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the RPR+, RPR- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.

(5)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal of rear seat pre-tensioner (RH) connector harness side connector from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU connector and rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector harness side connectors.
  • Continuity RPR- line between SRS-ECU connector and rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) connector
  • Continuity RPR+ line between SRS-ECU connector and rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness RPR+, RPR- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1654 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1655 2ND SEAT (RH) PRETEN. SQ GROUNDING<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1655: Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit earth) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1655 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) is shorted to earth
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connector
  • Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) harness shorted to earth.
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1655 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1655 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the rear seat belt with pre-tensioner (RH) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector.
(3)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the RPR+, RPR- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.
(5) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Continuity RPR+, RPR- line between SRS-ECU connector and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness RPR+, RPR- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1655 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1656 2ND SEAT (RH) PRETEN. SQ SHT TO BAT<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1656: Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit power supply) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1656 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) is shorted to power supply.
 
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connector
  • Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) (squib) harness shorted to power supply
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1656 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1656 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the rear seat belt with pre-tensioner (RH) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Voltage measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector.
(3)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (RH) harness side connector.
(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the RPR+, RPR- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(7) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Voltage RPR+, RPR- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the body earth
OK: 1 V or less
(8) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness RPR+, RPR- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1656 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1659 2ND SEAT (LH) PRETEN. SQUIB SHORT<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1659: Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) system (short circuit between squib circuit terminals) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1659 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the short circuit occurs to between the terminals of SRS-ECU rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) circuit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged short spring *
  • Short circuit between terminals of rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) circuit
  • Damaged connector(s)
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
  • Insufficient press of locking button or locking button not pressed
note *: The squib circuit connectors integrate a short spring (which prevents the rear seat belt pre-tensioner from being unintentionally deployed because of static electricity by shorting the positive wire to the earth wire in the squib circuit when the connectors are disconnected). Therefore, when the above codes are set, the short spring may not be released due to the damaged connector even when the connectors are connected.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1659 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Connector check: SRS-ECU, rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH)
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever. After disconnecting the SRS-ECU connector, connect it again.
(3) After disconnecting the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) harness side connector, connect the connector again. For the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) harness side connector disconnection, use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the harness side connector locking button. After releasing the lock, disconnect the harness side connector.
(4) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(5) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(6) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1659 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the connector concerned.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1659 set?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the rear seat belt with pre-tensioner (LH) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector.
(3)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) harness side connector.
(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the RPL+, RPL- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.
(5) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Continuity between RPL+, RPL- line
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wiring harness RPL+, RPL- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) connector.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1659 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1660 2ND SEAT (LH) PRETEN. SQUIB OPEN<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1660: Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) system (open circuit of squib circuit) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1660 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the open circuit occurs to the SRS-ECU rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) circuit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Poor contact of connector
  • Open circuit to rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) circuit
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(2) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(3) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1660 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis check by dummy resistor connection
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) harness side connector.
(3) Connect special tool dummy resistor (MB991865) to special tool resistor harness (MB991884).
(4) Connect special tool resistor harness to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) harness side connector.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) After erasing the diagnosis code memory, check the diagnosis code again.
(7) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is diagnosis code No. B1660 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the rear seat belt with pre-tensioner (LH) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at the SRS-ECU connector and the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) connector
(1) Check that the negative battery terminal is disconnected. If the negative battery terminal is connected, disconnect it.
(2) While pushing the part "A" indicated in the figure of the harness side connector, turn the lock lever to the direction of the arrow to release the lock lever, and disconnect the SRS-ECU connector.
(3)
dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.
Use the flat-tipped screwdriver to pull out the locking button of harness side connector. After releasing the lock, disconnect the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) harness side connector.
(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the RPL+, RPL- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.

(5)
cautionDo not insert a probe directly into the terminal of pre-tensioner (LH) connector harness side connector from the connector front side as the connector contact pressure may be weakened.
Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU connector and rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector harness side connectors.
  • Continuity RPL- line between SRS-ECU connector and rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) connector
  • Continuity RPL+ line between SRS-ECU connector and rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) connector
OK: Continuity (less than 2 Ω)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness RPL+, RPL- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) connector.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1660 set?
Replace SRS-ECU (Refer to SRS-ECU ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
 
52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1661 2ND SEAT (LH) PRETEN. SQ GROUNDING<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1661: Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit earth) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1661 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) is shorted to earth.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connector
  • Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) harness shorted to earth
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU

Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?

Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the RPL+, RPL- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.

  • Continuity between RPL+, RPL- line and body earth

STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Is diagnosis code No. B1661 set?

52 -INTERIOR AND SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM(SRS) > 52B-SUPPLEMENTAL RESTRAINT SYSTEM (SRS) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > DTC B1662 2ND SEAT (LH) PRETEN. SQ SHT TO BAT<VEHICLES FOR EUROPE (DOUBLE CAB) AND VEHICLES WITH>
Code No. B1662: Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) system (shorted to squib circuit power supply) <Vehicles for Europe (double cab) and vehicles with ERA-GLONASS system>
 
 
cautionIf diagnosis code No. B1662 is set in the SRS-ECU, be sure to diagnose the CAN bus line.
 
 
OPERATION
Only when the frontal impact exceeding the threshold is simultaneously detected (turned ON) by the front impact sensor as well as by the analogue G-sensor and safing G-sensor in SRS-ECU, the electric current is supplied from SRS-ECU to the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (squib).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
The code is set when the input terminal of SRS-ECU rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) is shorted to power supply.

  • Rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) (squib) harness shorted to power supply
  • Malfunction of SRS-ECU

dangerTo release the SRS-ECU connector short spring in the following operations, disconnect this rear seat belt pre-tensioner connector, and keep the squib circuit shorted.

(4)
cautionThe short spring may not be released due to the insufficient insertion. Therefore, insert the insulator for 4 mm or more.
Insert an insulator (width: 3 mm, thickness: 0.5 mm) such as cable tie between the RPL+, RPL- line and the short spring, and release the short spring.
(5) Connect the negative battery terminal.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(7) Take the measurements below at the SRS-ECU harness side connector.
  • Voltage between RPL+, RPL- line and body earth
OK: 1 V or less
(8) Disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the wiring harness RPL+, RPL- line between the SRS-ECU connector and the rear seat belt pre-tensioner (LH) connector.

Is diagnosis code No. B1662 set?
